snippet: Stephan Templ co-wrote a book documenting properties seized from Jewish owners and not returned after World War II. Then he himself became embroiled in a restitution case.
abstract: Austrian historian Stephan Templ begins one year prison term in Vienna following his conviction on charges of defrauding state; co-author of controversial 2001 book detailing seizing of Jewish properties by Nazis became embroiled in restitution case himself; supporters suggest punishment is politically motivated.
lead_paragraph: Stephan Templ co-wrote a book documenting properties seized from Jewish owners and not returned after World War II. Then he himself became embroiled in a restitution case.

headline.main: Historian Who Probed Austria’s Nazi Past Begins Sentence for Defrauding State
headline.print_headline: Historian Who Studied Austria’s Nazi Past Is Jailed

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
